abstract.p: NYC police arrest Peter Davila after standoff on Upper East Side of Manhattan in which Davila locked himself in his apartment with rifle (S)

block.p: Several blocks on the Upper East Side were sealed off by the police yesterday as officers tried to persuade a 37-year-old man with a rifle to surrender, the authorities said.

The standoff ended peacefully at 8:20 p.m. when officers got a key to Apartment 7W at 138 East 94th Street, between Lexington and Third Avenues, and forcibly removed the man, identified as Peter Davila. No charges were immediately filed against Mr. Davila, whom neighbors said had a history of psychiatric problems. He was taken to Metropolitan Hospital for observation.

The police sealed off Lexington Avenue between 93rd and 96th Streets for several hours.
Two neighbors called the police about 3 p.m., Sgt. Elias Nikas said. Inserting a camera through a keyhole, officers saw that he had a rifle and called a SWAT team.
